text: Michael Bernard Mukasey (; See inogolo:pronunciation of Michael Mukasey. born July 28, 1941) is an American lawyer and former judge. He served as the 81st Attorney General of the United States. Mukasey was appointed following the resignation of Alberto Gonzales. Mukasey also served for 18 years as a judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, appointed by Ronald Reagan, six of those years as Chief Judge. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:Living people Category:United States Attorneys General Category:American judges Category:Lawyers from New York City Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Michael Mukasey
